div.label: Search Our Site

a.title: Maize Unified School District 266

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Maize Board of Education meeting scheduled for 7 p.m. Monday

a.span: Maize Board of Education meeting scheduled for 7 p.m. Monday

div.p: The Maize Board of Education has scheduled a special meeting for 7 p.m. Monday, March 30. This meeting will be conducted virtually.

a.title: Go to comments for Maize Board of Education meeting scheduled for 7 p.m. Monday

img.alt: Dr. Chad Higgins, Superintendent of Maize USD 266

a.span: Dr. Higgins: Important update about March instruction and more

div.p: Staff members have been working to build a plan to provide support and instruction during the school building closure. It will be critical that our OneMa1ze school community comes together now more than ever.

a.title: Go to comments for Dr. Higgins: Important update about March instruction and more

img.alt: Maize USD 266 suspends all school gatherings starting Friday, March 13 at dismissal

a.span: Maize USD 266 suspends all school gatherings starting Friday, March 13 at dismissal

div.p: As of school dismissal on Friday, March 13, Maize USD 266 is suspending all group gatherings, including sports practices, facilities and ground rentals, scheduled gatherings, youth sports, Maize Recreation Fun Factory, etc.

a.title: Go to comments for Maize USD 266 suspends all school gatherings starting Friday, March 13 at dismissal

a.span: Bond issue projects to include infrastructure, roadway improvements

div.p: Maize USD 266 has been meeting with the City of Maize, architects, and others related to infrastructure, roads, sewers, and similar improvements needed in connection with the new buildings planned as part of the current bond issue.

a.title: Go to comments for Bond issue projects to include infrastructure, roadway improvements

img.alt: Dr. Chad Higgins, Superintendent of Maize USD 266

a.span: Dr. Higgins: Kindness matters for OneMa1ze, and you can find examples district-wide

div.p: As we work to foster a OneMa1ze school community that meets all students' needs, one common theme is kindness.

a.title: Go to comments for Dr. Higgins: Kindness matters for OneMa1ze, and you can find examples district-wide

img.alt: Maize USD 266 to contribute funding for traffic light near Maize South High

a.span: Maize USD 266 to contribute funding for traffic light near Maize South High

div.p: This has been an ongoing collaborative effort to improve safety and traffic flow in that area, affected by school-related traffic and challenges with the four-way stop.

a.title: Go to comments for Maize USD 266 to contribute funding for traffic light near Maize South High

a.span: Maize USD 266 vigilant regarding Coronavirus, community health

div.p: Maize USD 266 takes very seriously the health of its students and employees. District leaders, school administrators, and school nurses are working together in the best interest of the health of students and employees.

a.title: Go to comments for Maize USD 266 vigilant regarding Coronavirus, community health

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.title: Students hold paper cutouts that spell out OneMa1ze.
img.alt: Students hold paper cutouts that spell out OneMa1ze.

span.img: Our vision for a united school district began as a collective goal among Maize USD 266 administrative staff members at the beginning of the 2015-16 year. It since has inspired student artwork, charitable cooperation, a flash mob, and more.

p.span: From Eagles and Mavericks collaborating on fundraising community projects to high school students helping in our preschool classrooms, we are stronger together.
Thank you for your support, and please use the hashtag #OneMa1ze on social media to be a part of our story!

a.title: Select to open Accountability Reports
Select to open the Blackboard Learn Site in a new window.

img.alt: Select to open the Blackboard Learn Site in a new window.

a.title: Select to open the Kansas State Department of Education website in a new window.
Select to open the Skyward Family Access student information site

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

a.span: What is best for our students?

div.p: My district administrative team members know this is a question they often will hear me ask, as it is one that guides my decision-making as the superintendent of schools here at Maize USD 266. I want to ensure that Maize -- and its students and employees -- have great success. I aim to be fiscally responsible by striving for an efficient and strong education, not a cheap one, guided primarily by one question: What is best for our students? It will not always be an easy question to answer, but I look forward to the opportunity to seek an answer nonetheless. Thank you again for your continued support of this great district. We are better together working as OneMa1ze. Sincerely, Dr. Chad Higgins, Superintendent of Schools chiggins@usd266.com (Please click on the headline to read an expanded view of this message.)

a.title: Go to comments for What is best for our students?

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.title: Maslow's Pantry logo
img.span: Maslow's Pantry a free resource for entire OneMa1ze community

span.p: Maslow's Pantry is a students-helping-students program that provides food, hygiene items, and clothes to students, their families, and others in our community. The pantry is in the building in front of Maize High School that formerly served as the police station. Maslow's respects anonymity and depends on donations. Students visit to select items they need.

h2.span: How you can support Maslow's Pantry

span.p: Others interested in helping can deliver donations to the front office at Maize High, 11600 W. 45th St. North in Maize. Needs include dried boxed food, personal hygiene items, and prom dresses. A local business will dry clean and alter gowns for Maslow's prom dress exchange, which started last year and aims to be even larger this spring. Thank you for your support!

a.title: Go to comments for Announcement No. 1

div.p: District opens its first standalone preschool in August 2017, thanks to the bond issue passed in June 2015.

div.p: Maize USD 266 does not discriminate on the basis of disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals with disabilities, or in any aspect of their operations. Maize USD 266 also does not discriminate on the basis of disability in its hiring or employment practices.

Maize USD 266 also does not discriminate on the basis of disability in its hiring or employment practices.
